relation: first generation combining DIB0070 RF tuner with DIB7000 demodulator
combination of tuner + demodulator + USB bridge
title: DiBcom dibxxxx Chipset Family
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {73=Currently (2009-10-01) the DiBcom page lists these devices.}
textBeforeTable: Currently (2009-10-01) the DiBcom page lists these devices. The DiB7000 is DiBcom's second generation demodulator. (DiB3000 was the first generation.) search navigation, Jump to: ← Older revision | Latest revision (diff) | Newer revision → (diff) diff) ( (Talk | contribs) Malsachs Revision as of 13:04, 22 October 2011 by From LinuxTVWiki DiBcom DiB7xxx
textAfterTable: ✔ Yes BGA DIB7070-GP DVB-T MPEG2-TS ✘ No ✔ Yes BGA DIB7070-P DVB-T MPEG2-TS ✔ Yes ✘ No BGA DIB7070-Q DVB-T MPEG2-TS ✔ Yes ✘ No QFP Yannick Levy of DiBcom kindly provided some information in regard to the naming schema: DiBcom dibxxxx Chipset Family Chip description DIB0700 USB bridge DIB3000 first generation demodulator for DVB-T DIB7000 second generation demodulator for DVB-T DIB7700 combination of DIB0700+DIB7000 (demodulator+ USB bridge) DIB7070 first generation combining DIB0070 RF tuner with DIB7000 demodulator DIB7770 combination of tuner + demodulator + USB bridge The suffixes "P" are usually for PC applications and the "M" are for automotive applications. Further extensions are related to versions.
